51xgCF43n5iaMNLkxGs9.title: Social Media Online Application
51xgCF43n5iaMNLkxGs9.content:
• Users create and share links to articles about current affairs,
with comments.
• Users search for current affairs stories to view articles and
comments on them.
• Advertisers pay to promote their articles in the search results.
• Searches must be fast and the interface must look attractive.
Your competitor has a monolithic PHP-based application and
their deployment lead time is two days.

1Zs45g2y6GSE5s4XS9BA.title: Online Payments for Solar Power
1Zs45g2y6GSE5s4XS9BA.content:
• Users generate solar power on their roof and get payments for
their contributions to the grid.
• This application pays customers monthly by bank transfer.
Solar electricity contribution data is obtained from a third party
system.
• This application handles money and is regulated by financial
authorities.
Your competitor is a large energy company using Java and
their deployment lead time is two weeks.

G5JfGVoM7SZ6jOsdjWWp.title: Fitness & Running Mobile App
G5JfGVoM7SZ6jOsdjWWp.content:
Mobile exercise app monitors your running.
Gives feedback on lap time and coaches you towards your goals.
• The system sends encouraging emails with weekly fitness
summaries.
Handles potentially sensitive health data.
Your competitor is a Silicon Valley startup using Python and their
deployment lead time is six hours.

UUmhPl9KzWZ3v7Vt7nrT.title: Photo Editing Software
UUmhPl9KzWZ3v7Vt7nrT.content:
• Users edit their photos and compose them into albums.
• Users can have the albums printed (for a fee).
• Smooth, intuitive user experience is important.
• Large number of photo editing techniques are supported.
• Third parties handle printing, shipping, and payment.
Your competitor has a huge C++ codebase and their deployment
lead time is seven weeks.

k4ourZRR6MBxmfXJiDd5.title: Classified Ads for Second-Hand Items
k4ourZRR6MBxmfXJiDd5.content:
• Individuals pay to display advertisements on your site for items they
want to sell.
• Payment for advertisements is handled by a third party service.
• Users can search or browse categories to find items.
• Users can contact each other via messages on the site or by
telephone, and arrange to meet in person to buy and sell items.
Your competitor has a microservices architecture written in at least
five different languages, and their deployment lead time is less than
one hour.

sAgOgpSk0phDUfJ7d3Q7.title: A Developer Commits Code
sAgOgpSk0phDUfJ7d3Q7.subtitle: Delivery Step
sAgOgpSk0phDUfJ7d3Q7.content:
A developer shares their code
by pushing a commit to a
version control server, such
as Git.
If you include steps before
this, they do not count
towards your deployment
lead time.

vpttIdLCr7AEwNyFv75m.title: Deploy to Production Environment
vpttIdLCr7AEwNyFv75m.subtitle: Delivery Step
vpttIdLCr7AEwNyFv75m.content:
A Release Candidate is deployed to
production where there are actual
users and live data.
You cannot complete this step
until you have built the Release
Candidate.
If you include steps after this,
they do not count towards your
deployment lead time.

gFDFKdnMmbwL5Vt7ouDE.title: Build Release Candidate
gFDFKdnMmbwL5Vt7ouDE.subtitle: Build Step
gFDFKdnMmbwL5Vt7ouDE.content:
Code is compiled and built
into a deployable Release
Candidate.
You cannot complete this step
before the Code is Merged to
Trunk.

oMSlvF0Vn5Bt0F9YYZbQ.title:
Deploy to Production-Like
Test Environment 1
oMSlvF0Vn5Bt0F9YYZbQ.subtitle: Deployment Step
oMSlvF0Vn5Bt0F9YYZbQ.content:
Deploy to protected environment
with production-like hardware where
everyone in the IT department can
use and test it with (anonymized)
production-like data. (May be called ‘QA’
or ‘Pre-prod’, etc instead of 1, 2, 3).

4wEMpQdP5N52iurAkiZR.title:
Deploy to Production-Like
Test Environment 2
4wEMpQdP5N52iurAkiZR.subtitle: Deployment Step
4wEMpQdP5N52iurAkiZR.content:
Deploy to protected environment
with production-like hardware where
everyone in the IT department can
use and test it with (anonymized)
production-like data. (May be called ‘QA’
or ‘Pre-prod’, etc instead of 1, 2, 3).

7MpHg7z6NSNKkcNmY11a.title:
Deploy to Production-Like
Test Environment 3
7MpHg7z6NSNKkcNmY11a.subtitle: Deployment Step
7MpHg7z6NSNKkcNmY11a.content:
Deploy to protected environment
with production-like hardware where
everyone in the IT department can
use and test it with (anonymized)
production-like data. (May be called ‘QA’
or ‘Pre-prod’, etc instead of 1, 2, 3).

5Hq5DBmvxTtsFyto0weW.title: Unit Testing
5Hq5DBmvxTtsFyto0weW.subtitle: Test Step
5Hq5DBmvxTtsFyto0weW.content:
Tests written by developers are
run against all the individual
classes and methods in the
system.

bG1qFmdarVbhXquuWkly.title: Automated Load Test
bG1qFmdarVbhXquuWkly.subtitle: Test Step
bG1qFmdarVbhXquuWkly.content:
Bombard the system with
many concurrent requests,
measure response times and
system performance.

Q8339NFFpyhfDz83s0ke.title: Static Code Analysis
Q8339NFFpyhfDz83s0ke.subtitle: Test Step
Q8339NFFpyhfDz83s0ke.content:
Run a tool on the source code
that measures complexity,
class and method size, circular
dependencies, etc. Assess
whether measured values are
acceptable compared to a
standard.

EWGhSgDp444Bvx90TI9W.title: User Acceptance Testing
EWGhSgDp444Bvx90TI9W.subtitle: Test Step
EWGhSgDp444Bvx90TI9W.content:
End-user representatives
validate that the functionality
works in the way they want it
to work.

7tuSNJdQmKPnGIaqrf6u.title: Security & Penetration Testing
7tuSNJdQmKPnGIaqrf6u.subtitle: Test Step
7tuSNJdQmKPnGIaqrf6u.content:
Skilled testers explore the
system in a structured way
looking for security issues.

KRdlU3yCjCDu7LXDDkkQ.title: Code is Merged to Trunk (Master)
KRdlU3yCjCDu7LXDDkkQ.subtitle: Delivery Step
KRdlU3yCjCDu7LXDDkkQ.content:
All developers can now see,
use, and build on this code.
You cannot build the Release
Candidate before this pipeline
step has completed.

aqmtzNJsJ2Rq0amtNaVC.title: Usability Testing
aqmtzNJsJ2Rq0amtNaVC.subtitle: Test Step
aqmtzNJsJ2Rq0amtNaVC.content:
UX experts observe real users
using the system to see how
they behave and how they use
features.

9tzSep5ORXJoylxVlb6M.title: Automated Smoke Test
9tzSep5ORXJoylxVlb6M.subtitle: Test Step
9tzSep5ORXJoylxVlb6M.content:
One very basic feature is
exercised, such as “View the
login screen”. Nothing more is
tested.

Smxjkq3JZNEJ7r3zVfyK.title: Automated User Interface Testing
Smxjkq3JZNEJ7r3zVfyK.subtitle: Test Step
Smxjkq3JZNEJ7r3zVfyK.content:
Test scripts exercise a wide
variety of functionality in the
system, using the UI in the
same way as an actual user.

EoORqrovfdC02W0GWKyb.title: Deploy on Build Agent
EoORqrovfdC02W0GWKyb.subtitle: Deployment Step
EoORqrovfdC02W0GWKyb.content:
The whole system is deployed
on a single machine. Third
party services are replaced by
mocks or stubs. Databases,
load balancers, and queues
may be omitted, or substituted
by in-memory lightweight
alternatives.

euc9onmGXFCKz4EMXAh2.title: Code Review
euc9onmGXFCKz4EMXAh2.subtitle: Test Step
euc9onmGXFCKz4EMXAh2.content:
Source code is examined and
assessed by developers other
than the original author.

15tVTz9XKHPxagkBwFLD.title: Deployment Health Check
15tVTz9XKHPxagkBwFLD.subtitle: Test Step
15tVTz9XKHPxagkBwFLD.content:
Verify the software has deployed
correctly. For example, you could
check:
• The database schema is valid.
• All services are registered and
discoverable.
• Needed ports are opened.
• Logs are being produced.

TdUxJ7APAa8mHfANtlRn.title: Contract Testing
TdUxJ7APAa8mHfANtlRn.subtitle: Test Step
TdUxJ7APAa8mHfANtlRn.content:
Verify the software will integrate
correctly with a third party service
by ensuring it fulfills the contract
required by that service. The
contract test should be supplied by
the third party and is run against
our software.

16c8sWQTSXcXoFx3QJCe.title: Third Party Integration Testing
16c8sWQTSXcXoFx3QJCe.subtitle: Test Step
16c8sWQTSXcXoFx3QJCe.content:
Verify the system talks to a third
party service correctly. The third
party may provide a ‘test’ version
of their component, for example a
payment service that doesn’t make
real payments.

oW2c37tpOK3qYQWdb9M7.title: Component Testing
oW2c37tpOK3qYQWdb9M7.subtitle: Test Step
oW2c37tpOK3qYQWdb9M7.content:
Test only one component of
the system. Replace the other
components with mocks or fake
objects.
Also known as ‘module testing.’

6IqpaCa4X9RfXlJS9WE3.title: Automated Functional Testing
6IqpaCa4X9RfXlJS9WE3.subtitle: Test Step
6IqpaCa4X9RfXlJS9WE3.content:
These tests each execute a
function of the system, checking
both happy paths and error
conditions. They use an API to
access functionality instead of the
User Interface.

ST0wgNZhTclzqSRizg0Y.title: End-to-End Testing
ST0wgNZhTclzqSRizg0Y.subtitle: Test Step
ST0wgNZhTclzqSRizg0Y.content:
These tests execute all parts of
the system, including third party
components. They may be manual
or automated.

gkCXoVnzA0r3TM3xJZsh.title: Create Release Notes
gkCXoVnzA0r3TM3xJZsh.subtitle: Build Step
gkCXoVnzA0r3TM3xJZsh.content:
Alongside the Release Candidate,
we also publish notes about what
changes are included in this
deployment. The release notes
may be assembled by hand or
generated automatically.

KdqSH6RykC4qsYENGpnh.title: Build Snapshot Version
KdqSH6RykC4qsYENGpnh.subtitle: Build Step
KdqSH6RykC4qsYENGpnh.content:
Code is compiled and built
into a deployable unit, which
is labelled as “snapshot.”
This means it is not suitable for
deployment in production, it is
only for testing.

V3KgW196nrobZiQXAL5g.title: Decide Release Version Number
V3KgW196nrobZiQXAL5g.subtitle: Build Step
V3KgW196nrobZiQXAL5g.content:
When the package is deployed
it should have a unique
name or number to identify
it, for example “4.6.12” or
“989c45ef21” or “gingerbread.”
It could be automatically
generated, or decided manually.

4OLftJ9cS5lJ49xtdUzT.title: Go/No Go Decision Meeting
4OLftJ9cS5lJ49xtdUzT.subtitle: Test Step
4OLftJ9cS5lJ49xtdUzT.content:
A group of managers, testers and
other stakeholders meet to assess
whether to deploy the new version
of the software. They base their
decision on test results, perceived
risks, market conditions and cost
of delay.
